definitions.definition: ( the third-person plural nominative ) A group of entities previously mentioned. [since 13th c.]
examples: Fred and Jane? They just arrived.
Dogs may bark if they want to be fed.
Plants wilt if they are not watered.
I have a car and a truck, but they are both broken.

definitions.definition: ( the third-person singular nominative , occasionally proscribed ) A single person, previously mentioned, whose gender is unknown, irrelevant, or ( since 21st c. ) non-binary . [since 14th c.]
examples: Somebody requested a seat at Friday's performance but didn't say if they preferred the balcony or the floor.
If someone enters the restricted area, they are required to present identification.
I asked my friend if they wanted to come, but they said no.
One of the boys tripped over, and they hit their head on the door.

definitions.definition: ( indefinite pronoun, vague meaning ) People; some people; people in general; someone, excluding the speaker.
examples: They say it’s a good place to live.
They didn’t have computers in the old days.

definitions.definition: ( indefinite pronoun ) The authorities, the (power) elites, the powers that be , the establishment , the man , the system : government, police, employers, etc.
examples: They' ll tax us for the air we breathe next.
Ha, you believe the moon is real? That's just what they want you to think.

definitions.definition: ( bridge ) The opponents of the side which is keeping score .

main_definition: ( the third-person plural nominative ) A group of entities previously mentioned. [since 13th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( the third-person singular nominative , occasionally proscribed ) A single person, previously mentioned, whose gender is unknown, irrelevant, or ( since 21st c. ) non-binary . [since 14th c.]
( indefinite pronoun, vague meaning ) People; some people; people in general; someone, excluding the speaker.
( indefinite pronoun ) The authorities, the (power) elites, the powers that be , the establishment , the man , the system : government, police, employers, etc.
( bridge ) The opponents of the side which is keeping score .

definitions.definition: There ( especially as an expletive subject of be ) .

main_definition: ( US dialectal ) There ( especially as an expletive subject of be ) . [from 19th c.]
